Package cycleguard.database.accessor

Class AbstractDatabaseAccessor<EntryType extends AbstractDatabaseEntry>

java.lang.Object
cycleguard.database.accessor.AbstractDatabaseAccessor<EntryType>
Type Parameters:
EntryType - Object class to be stored within the DynamoDB table. This class must implement AbstractDatabaseEntry, be annotated DynamoDbBean, and have a getter annotated with DynamoDbPartitionKey.
The AbstractDatabaseUserEntry handles the partition key, automatically setting it to the user ID.
Direct Known Subclasses:
AchievementInfoAccessor, AuthTokenAccessor, FriendRequestAccessor, FriendsListAccessor, GlobalLeaderboardsAccessor, HealthInfoAccessor, NotificationsAccessor, PackDataAccessor, PackInvitesAccessor, PurchaseInfoAccessor, TripCoordinatesAccessor, TripHistoryAccessor, UserCredentialsAccessor, UserDailyGoalAccessor, UserProfileAccessor, UserSettingsAccessor, UserStatsAccessor, WeekHistoryAccessor
@Component @Configuration public abstract class AbstractDatabaseAccessor<EntryType extends AbstractDatabaseEntry> extends Object
Wrapper for DynamoDB database access. Subclasses must implement getTableInstance to return a singleton instance of the DynamoDB table, along with setting AbstractDatabaseAccessor to the class to be stored.
See UserProfileAccessor for an example of extending this class.

When this class is extended and a new table is added, the AWS IAM policy must be updated to include that table (ask Jason to update that).

    • client

      private static final software.amazon.awssdk.enhanced.dynamodb.DynamoDbEnhancedClient client

    • databaseCacheService

      @Autowired private DatabaseCacheService databaseCacheService

    • cache

      private final TreeMap<String,CacheEntry<EntryType extends AbstractDatabaseEntry>> cache
      Temporarily stores database entries to be retrieved later, to avoid excess database reads and writes.
      Maps String keys to CacheEntry values.
      Blank entries are stored for 1000 ms.
      See Also:
      • CacheEntry

    • blankEntries

      private final TreeMap<String,Long> blankEntries
      Collection of entries that are blank. Blank entries are stored for 5000 ms.
      See Also:
      • CacheEntry

  • Method Details

    • clearOldCacheEntries

      public void clearOldCacheEntries(long curSysTime)
      Purges cache and blank entries that expired prior to the system clock's current value. Called within DatabaseCacheService on an internal timer.
      Parameters:
      curSysTime - System clock's current value, in milliseconds
      See Also:
      • System.currentTimeMillis()

    • subscribeToCache

      @PostConstruct public void subscribeToCache()
      Subscribes to the cache's timer upon accessor initialization.

    • getClient

      protected software.amazon.awssdk.enhanced.dynamodb.DynamoDbEnhancedClient getClient()
      Gets the singleton instance of the DynamoDbEnhancedClient, which is used to access tables.
      Returns:
      Singleton DynamoDbEnhancedClient

    • getKey

      private software.amazon.awssdk.enhanced.dynamodb.Key getKey(String key)
      Returns the DynamoDB-specific key to a table, given a String DynamoDbPartitionKey.
      Parameters:
      key - Partition key of the object to access
      Returns:
      Key to access an object of the current table

    • getEntry

      public EntryType getEntry(String key)
      Returns the entry in a table, given a String DynamoDbPartitionKey.
      Parameters:
      key - Value of partition key of the object to access
      Returns:
      Object of type AbstractDatabaseAccessor: database object with that partition key
      null if the key does not exist in the table

    • getEntryOrDefaultBlank

      @NonNull public EntryType getEntryOrDefaultBlank(String key)
      Returns the entry in a table, given a String DynamoDbPartitionKey. If the entry doesn't exist in the database, return a blank entry instead.
      Parameters:
      key - Value of partition key of the object to access
      Returns:
      Object of type AbstractDatabaseAccessor: database object with that partition key
      Guaranteed to not return null

    • hasEntry

      public boolean hasEntry(String key)
      Returns if the String DynamoDbPartitionKey has an associated entry in the table.
      Parameters:
      key - Value of partition key of the object to access
      Returns:
      true if the key is found in the table, false otherwise

    • setEntry

      public void setEntry(EntryType entry)
      Adds the provided entry into the table.
      Parameters:
      entry - Object to put into the database. Must have a getter annotated with DynamoDbPartitionKey, along with a matching setter.

    • deleteEntry

      public void deleteEntry(String key)
      Deletes the item in the table with DynamoDbPartitionKey matching the provided String key. Does nothing if key is not found.
      Parameters:
      key - Value of partition key of the object to delete

    • getBlankEntry

      protected abstract EntryType getBlankEntry()
      Returns a blank instance of the database entry, of type AbstractDatabaseAccessor extending AbstractDatabaseEntry.
      Returns:
      Blank AbstractDatabaseAccessor of extending subclass

      protected abstract software.amazon.awssdk.enhanced.dynamodb.DynamoDbTable<EntryType> getTableInstance()
      Must be implemented in subclasses. Returns a singleton instance of the DynamoDbTable.
      Returns:
      Singleton instance of the DynamoDbTable
